com.soa.transport.http.deploy
Interface ServletRegistration

All Known Implementing Classes:
DelegatingServletRegistration, SimpleServletRegistration
public interface ServletRegistration

Instances of this interface can be published as OSGi services, which will result in any capable HTTP server registering the servlet and publishing it. This is an SOA-specific registration interface, and will work with the SOA HTTP service either in a standalone deployment or inside a J2EE container.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getContext()
          Get the root context that this servlet belongs to.
 java.util.Map getContextAttributes()
          Get any context attributes that should be added to the servlet context
 java.util.Map getInitParameters()
          Get the init parameters for the servlet.

          The servlet name.
 java.lang.String getPathSpec()
          This is a path spec as defined by the servlet specification.
 javax.servlet.Servlet getServlet()
          Get the actual servlet instance to register with the server
 boolean isInitOnStartup()
          Should the servlet be initialized at deployment time?
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The servlet name. This required and may not be null.

Returns:
The servlet name. This must be a non-null string that is a unique identifier for this servlet in the application it belongs to.

getInitParameters

java.util.Map getInitParameters()
Get the init parameters for the servlet. In many case, the init parameters will be redundant because the servlet instance may alredy have been initialized in Spring or through some other mechanism. In some case though, legacy servlets require the normal servlet lifecycly with a callback to init().

Returns:
The init params for the servlet.

getContextAttributes

java.util.Map getContextAttributes()
Get any context attributes that should be added to the servlet context

Returns:
A Map of servlet context attributes, or null or an empty Map if none.

getPathSpec

java.lang.String getPathSpec()
This is a path spec as defined by the servlet specification. There are three possible forms for this value:
  • *.<suffix> This is used to map a file/resource suffix to this servlet.
  • <literal>/* Maps a literal string and all sub-paths to this servlet
  • <literal> Map a literal path exactly to the servlet
Note that this value is relative to the context returned from getContext(), it is not an absolute path.

Returns:
Returns the pathSpec.

getContext

java.lang.String getContext()
Get the root context that this servlet belongs to. This allows the framework to associate the servlet with a web application in scenarios where there may be multiple web applications deployed. If this is used as part of a WebAppRegistration, this value is ignored.

Returns:
The string root context path for the web application that this servlet belongs to. This may be null, in which case it is assumed to be "/".

getServlet

javax.servlet.Servlet getServlet()
Get the actual servlet instance to register with the server

Returns:
The servlet instance. The servlet will be initialized through its init(ServletContext) method when it is first retrieved.

isInitOnStartup

boolean isInitOnStartup()
Should the servlet be initialized at deployment time?

Returns:
Returns true if the servlet should be initialized when deployed
